CatDescriptText: The lead headline in city edition of New Pittsburgh Courier in the window reads: "Nat'l Drive to Halt Construction" and subheading, "Pittsburgh Prime Target."  Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 11, 1970, pg. 24, reads: "Model Cities Elections - the following areas have nominated these Candidates for Chairmanship and Vice-Chairmanship of their respective neighborhood planning teams...Mattie Howard, Katie Johnson, Otto Simonson, Alfred Hunt. Not shown, but in the running - Beatrice Bankston, Charles Love, Thelma Lovette, Lorenzo Hill, Harry Ward, James McCoy, George Childress, Len B. Hooe...Area II, Tuesday, July 14, 1970, 7:30 P.M., Place: St. Richards School, Corner Bedford Ave. & Wandless Street, Pittsburgh, Pa. 15219."
TitMainTitle: Woman, and man wearing sweater with arrow pattern, and small afro hairstyle, standing outside of New Pittsburgh Courier building, with newspaper in window with headline "National Drive To Halt Construction...", 315 Carson Street, South Side
